intro: Christisonia wightii, commonly known as the Wight's Christisonia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often branched stems. It is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing specialized features for water conservation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
